dialogue: So I really shouldn’t have bothered to write out that whole report for him, because they didn’t need it and didn’t even read it.
Oh how annoying.
It really was. Sometimes I swear they don’t realize I have a life and would rather be home with you guys than typing up reports at 11pm on a Thursday from my hotel room.
Well, we had a fine week. We went to Book Babies.
I thought you hated Book Babies?
Oh I do. It was an accident, truth be told, but he loved it.
You’re still alive, ya ol’ furball?
She is the cat who will never die. Even though nobody really pays any attention to her anymore. Baby, no! Don’t chase the cat.
Speaking of furballs - I’m like... I don’t know.
What?
No. I shouldn’t have brought it up. I’m just having some odd side effects maybe of perimenopause? I’m not sure. Weird hair sprouting up?
You talking about your nipples?
No! Lower back. And kind of my toes too. I don’t know. I just feel off. I feel like I have this heightened sense of smell - kind of like when I was pregnant. The cat’s butt smells disgusting to me.
That’s not just you.
And my teeth seem to be getting sharper. Look!
Oh yeah. Definitely. Your teeth look so weird. This is real and not in your head.
I’m sorry, but honey you always think something is wrong with you.
Well, that’s the thing about being a hypochondriac - one day I will be right! And then you’ll be sorry.
I can’t remember the last time I washed this shirt. *
I never washed any of my clothes * for all of college. You’re just * like a bachelor.
I mean, it’s just like... what’s the point? I always hated hard pants. I’m giving in to just a soft- pants lifestyle.
You’re living the dream.

I’m the housewife I never wanted to be! You know what’s the hardest part? It’s like I’m on suicide watch and I can’t look away for even a second. Or he might stick a fork into a light socket, or like walk off a cliff. Why does he want to kill himself? It’s so much more mentally exhausting than I expected.
It’s better than leaving him with those awful ladies at the awful daycare, right?
I guess. That was heartbreaking.
If you wake him up I will rip your throat out.
I thought this is what you wanted. No more long hours at the gallery and crying while you pumped your boobs in a bathroom.
I did, I do. But maybe I need to find a part-time job or something? So I don’t lose my mind.
It’s just the math doesn’t totally add up. The likelihood of you making more than we would have to pay a sitter-
I know. And there aren’t really part time gallery jobs. Or part time nannies.
Right.
Maybe when he starts school.
Yeah. You just gotta hold on till Kindergarten.

Then I think - how dare I complain? What a gift - to get to be with my baby all day long. I should be grateful- on the scale of people who have things to complain about I’m at the bottom. I’m just a fucking privileged white lady who gets to stay home and make cookies all day.
Do you make cookies?
Not once.
I would kill to get to stay home with him every day, for what that’s worth.
You think that. But I can assure you, you would not.

HEY! His fucking binky! Do you not hear him? The husband wakes, totally confused, and she turns her back * to them to let him figure it out. He fumbles and puts the * binky back in his son’s mouth, who quiets.
Did you make coffee?
Not yet - will you do it?
Uh... sure. Is it two scoops?
I do three.
So, last night... you were kind of a-
Bitch?
You said it not me.
Yep. Night bitch. I am Nightbitch.

I sort of said it like that so that he could see I’m a good sport. I’m not like uptight, or not able to poke fun at myself. But once I said it, I knew the horrible truth. Nightbitch has always been there.
What’s next?
Bath time.
I’ll do it. Let’s go little dude.
Thank you.
He is a good man. He is. He wasn’t always so literal and cut off-
Hon? Can you get him a piece of toast?
He needs a glass of water!
Can you put his towel in the dryer so it’s warmed up?
What?
Nothing.
Need anything else? While I’m up?
It’s just - when you’re gone, I do this by myself every day.
Say ‘bye-bye dada’
Bye-bye dada!
Enjoy getting four full nights of sleep!
Are you going to be okay?
Yeah yeah. I will.
You really should stop worrying about your weird hair growth or whatever and get on top of your week. Structure you know? I read an article that said structure was the key to mental health.
Uh huh.
Make a plan ... draw up a schedule. Treat it like it’s your job. Happiness is a choice.
Happiness is a choice.
I’m sure you’re right. I’ll try.
Let’s have a good day, okay?
Today we’re going to have an art day! Doesn’t that sound fun?
You can put your fingers in, or your feet!
Yeah! That’s right.
Okay okay. On the paper. The paper, okay?
Isn’t this fun? But on the paper.
uhhhhh fuck.
Wait, you cut it open?
I had to release the pressure. You don’t understand.
You need to call a doctor- that’s not safe.
I haven’t told you the weirdest part.
What?
It had hair. In the cyst. There was hair.
Honey- I...
I know. I know. But I’m telling you... it’s like I have a tail - you know those babies who are born with a tail? A fucking- Sorry, a freakin- tail.
It’s not a tail. It’s a cyst that was exacerbated when you fell. And cysts are known to have hair. It’s not a weird thing. The weird thing is that you haven’t taken yourself to a doctor.
What I can’t tell him is that I have such a strong urge to wag it.
We’re out of milk.
Are we?
We have twenty pounds of raw meat, but no milk.
Can you please close the door?
How can we be out of milk?
Because he drank it.
But did you know?
Did I know?
Did you know we were out?
I don’t know.
What does that mean?

This is the first shower I have had this week. I’ve been to the supermarket three times, but I haven’t gotten to wash my body in at least four days. So clearly I didn’t realize that we were out of milk or I would have gotten some.

You are free to go to the market with our son and pick some up if you want. And while you’re there get me some tampons, ok? I’m about to start bleeding and I have a feeling this one is going to be a doozy!
Okay, that’s the end of the book. I don’t suppose you want to just lie down and go right to sleep do you?
No. It’s your turn.
What? He doesn’t want me.

I don’t care that he doesn’t want you. I have been doing night nights every night of every day for two hundred years and they are fucking killing me. You have to do night night. IT’S YOUR NIGHT NIGHT TURN!
Okay. But for the record I really don’t like the term “night night”.
Nooooo.
I just... don’t want one more thing needing me or touching me.
You wanna...?
God, no.
I didn’t mean that. I just meant -
Uh huh. Pretty harsh.
I’m sorry, I’m just in so much fucking pain, you have no idea.
Oh, gotcha. Sorry.
Also I have eight nipples now and fear you’d be repulsed.
It’s under the bed! You wanna see what I got you?
Now baby. Doggies go to night night in their beds right?
And do doggies use binkies? Noooo.
Night night doggie.
Dare to be stupid, dare to be stupid. What did I say? Dare to be stupid. Tell me, what did I say? Dare to be stupid. It’s alright. Dare to be stupid. We can be stupid all night.
NORMA! Look baby, it’s Norma.
It’s just a game. We play dogs. And he loves it!
Okay. And he’s eating out of a dog bowl? He looks to two silver dog bowls in the drying rack.
Sometimes. Yes. Sometimes we eat out of perfectly new, never-been- used-by-a-real-dog dog bowls. For fun.
And he has a collar?
Yes. He wanted to be domesticated. I was against that.
Oh, and he sleeps in a dog bed.
What now?
But I haven’t had to lie with him for hours on end to get him to fall asleep - I just give a little growl and he goes to bed on his own. Without a B.I.N.K.Y.
I don’t want to criticize. It’s just maybe a little confusing for him is all.
For him? Or for you?
You have to see how weird this is!

No I don’t. What’s the problem? He’s sleeping, which means I’m sleeping for the first time in two fucking years. We are getting so much exercise - I’m not waking up with pain in my back anymore. We’re having fun. When did you become so uptight?
A woman, when pushed to her limit, will call on all her faculties to care for her young.

For the mother - especially the mother of infants and very small children - occupies that peculiar space of in-between - not fully human nor fully animal - and it is in this liminal otherworld where we find many of the most compelling magical women.
huuuuh huuuuuhh huuuuuuh.
Yeaaaaahhhhhhhh!!!!
This is where my son rolled in the grass -sweet hot breath, little banana cream breath. And mine. Mine when I was... human.
I knew it!
Where’d you go?
I went for a run. I needed to clear my head.
Did you run barefoot?
You’re so dirty.
Can I get in?
Sure.
Oh.
I told you.
Right. The doggie thing.
Oh honey - do you feel left out?
Now, beg!
Shut up! We fed you, you stupid animal.
Kitty! I’m going to throw you onto the roof and let you starve to death up there.
Maybe a chicken hawk will swoop down and grab her with its talons while she’s up there.
Then take her up into the sky and drop her from a great height into a deep quarry where heaving mining equipment with caterpillar treads will repeatedly run over her broken corpse.
Wow. Specific.
Thanks.
Which way? Mammals?
Sure!
What was that about?
Nothing. She’s a new friend.
She is?
I think I’m having a bit of a realization. Maybe it’s all the dead animals everywhere I look- makes you think about your mortality.
What’s the realization?
I don’t think I’m an artist anymore.
It’s, like, a hard thing to admit I guess. I don’t know why I’m getting upset about it. I’m not upset.
No, you don’t seem upset at all.

Because... I have this running list of all the things I’m not doing every day - all the ways I’m falling behind as an artist. And I feel like if I could just focus on what I AM doing I would be much happier.
I could see that.
I am just a mom now. I should focus on being the best mom I can be - enjoying these moments with him, because this isn’t going to last. He’s growing up so fast.
That’s true.
And being an artist is such a silly, self-absorbed thing to be. It’s truly an embarrassing job to say out loud. What am I, six? Picking between an artist or a princess?
I think there’s sort of a relief in just letting it all go, you know? And being in this moment, with him. And letting that be my goal for now.
Okay. If that’s what you want.
That’s what I want.
Bite my neck.
What?
Bite my neck, hard.
Maybe that’s what all mothers secretly need. One night of violence to get it out of our systems. I do feel better now. Lighter. And it’s done. I’m me again.
I’m taking your advice. I’m making a plan for the week. A schedule for us.
Oh. Good.
See- Monday is gymnastics at the play space. Tuesday is Book Babies at the library- my fave. Wednesday: mommy/baby yoga in the park. Thursday is free day and Friday is Tyke Hike!
Wow. Okay.
I mean, if I’m gonna do it, I should just commit. Right?
Right.
And you remember that I said I would meet up with my grad school friends in the city tonight, right?
Yes. I’m babysitting.
It’s not babysitting when it’s your own kid.
Whatever. You know what I mean. I’m on bedtime duty. And you are going to go have a grown up dinner.
Yep. At 9 pm. Four hours later than I usually eat.
Yowsa. You look nice.
Maybe I shouldn’t go. Are you guys going to be alright?
We got this. We’re good, right little dude?
Oh god, she does that when she has a shit stuck on her butt. This- fucking cat. Someone has to wash her.
Not it.
Come on! I can’t. I never get to go out.
I’ll take care of him, if you’ll take care of the cat.
Nobody in this fucking family can clean their own butts.
I used to do this. Go out and see people. Talk about grown up things. I can do this.
Late night?
Oh, yeah I slept on Naya’s couch. It was easier to just stay in the city.
Why didn’t you text me?
I didn’t want to wake you up.
You know I have my phone on silent at night.
Is there something you want to tell me?
What do you mean?
I don’t know.
Okay, fine - I got a little drunk. It was really weird seeing all those people again after all this time. It made me feel like shit. So I drank my dinner and missed the * last bus. I’m sorry. *
Why did it make you feel like shit? It was supposed to be your fun night out.
Because I’m not doing anything with my life. Because they think I’m just a mother now. Which I am. I mean, I know I am. But they think it’s pathetic and it made me feel pathetic.
They don’t have any clue. They don’t have kids. They don’t know what they’re missing.
Naya does. She has a kid. And she works all the time. And she’s successful and happy and I don’t understand how she is able to do all that.
Her husband is super rich.
Right. That’s true.
At some point you’re going to have to start accepting that we’ve made some choices over the years that landed us here. I don’t know about you, but I wouldn’t trade those choices for the world.
Don’t.
This is what you want? I’m gonna throw up.
Blood. Flesh. Rot.
Oh fuck oh fuck oh fuck.
It just doesn’t make sense to me.
I know.
The cat died and you didn’t even call me?
It was a pretty traumatic morning. There was blood all over the steps, and we had to bury her, and-
I could have helped.
I guess I’m getting used to doing things by myself.
Oh.
This has made some things really clear to me though-
Like what?
I’m not doing okay. You must see that. I’m not okay. I’m not happy.
You were so quick to support me when I said I didn’t want to be an artist anymore -
You said that’s what you wanted.

So quick. No protestations from you! And I keep running over that conversation in my head. Because it would have been so nice for you to encourage me at least a little bit not to quit. Tell me that I was good at what I did, and it would be a shame to give it up. Say that I would return to it one day. But you just smiled.
No I didn’t.
Because somewhere you were getting what you’ve always wanted. For me to be a stay at home mom.
Now, wait a minute-
Just like your mother. And her mother. A sweet deal for you. You have your job and I have mine. Only my job has no pay and no appreciation and no vacation days and includes washing your underwear.
I didn’t say that. This feels like a trap.

You feel trapped? Do you have any fucking clue how trapped I am? I’ve found myself in a fucking 1950s marriage somehow and I have no idea who I am anymore and all I do is take care of our son and you and the fucking cat- before I killed her.
It was your idea to quit your job. I didn’t suggest that.

You’re right. I agreed to it, but I had no fucking idea what I was agreeing to. I didn’t realize I would feel like a single parent who has zero help and has to give up my dreams to take care of everyone! I don’t even know who I am anymore!
I don’t know what to say. I didn’t know you felt like this.
HOW CAN YOU NOT SEE ME? I’m wilting while you’re out succeeding.
You think I want it like this? I don’t want to be married to my mother. I don’t want to feel your resentment the moment I enter my house.

If you were so fucking unhappy why didn’t you tell me? You expect me to read your mind? If you tell me that everything is fine, then I think that everything is fine. If you tell me that you want to quit being an artist and stay home with our son, and I say ok, I think I’m supporting you. That’s just some passive-aggressive bullshit.
Okay... but-

You aren’t the person I married either. The person I married let things go that weren’t important, and was tough as shit. She was weird and excited about things in the world, like reading books and not just watching reality tv and passing out after her second glass of wine.
Oh my fucking god. I can’t believe you’re saying that to me.
It’s disappointing. For me too. I don’t know how we ended up here. You’re too worried about what happened at Book Babies to ask about my work or to stay up on current events.
What happened to that girl? The one I married who made me think about the world in new and challenging ways, huh?
She fucking died in childbirth. And she’s not coming back.
I’m sorry to wake you.
I’m really confused - I don’t understand how we got here.
I know you are. Because I haven’t been sharing with you everything that’s been going on with me. But to be fair, you also haven’t been asking.
Okay.

This agreement we made, that I would stay home and you would go to work isn’t working for me anymore. I need... space. I don’t even know how to - I don’t know who I am or what I need. I need to dig around in the dark and find myself again.
Do you regret having a kid?
No. I don’t. But I had no clue what we were actually getting into. If I could go back in time, I would have made us sit down and work out a more equitable way to do this parenting thing.
I would have been open to that.
I’m sorry.
Me too.
Is it too late?
Thank you for letting us come along. This is so beautiful.
Voila. Dinner is served.
NOOOOOOO! Shit!
Wait wait, don’t get down. Stay in your chair. There’s broken glass. Or porcelain or whatever it is. Hold on. Ah! Hold on. Where are the towels?
How do I do this? Oh my god. Hold on.
Don’t move! Do you hear me? Don’t move.
Okay. Going great. I am killing it.
There’s my baby!!
How did it go?
Come. Have some food.
We had a good night, didn’t we, dude? It was hard. I’m not gonna lie. It was... hard. He missed you. And my place is... a little weird. Sterile.
Sure. I get it.
How was your first night alone?

It was really wonderful, actually. I think I have an idea for a new project. I’m just really focused. It’s amazing how efficient I can be now that I never have any time. Give me an hour and I’m doing more than I used to do in a week.
You want some hashbrowns, baby?
So I’ll drop him off Friday morning?
Okay. Yeah. I need to get some toys at my place. He was so bored. And maybe a stuffy or something?
That’s a good idea. I’ll send you the link for that dinosaur he loves. You could get him one for your place. And I’ll pack more for him too.
Okay yeah.
He’s really sweet. But he’s also not used to me. I kinda felt like he thought he’d been kidnapped.
That will change. This is gonna be good for both of you.

He’s like ‘who is this weird man living in this sad apartment complex with all the other sad men?’ I swear the whole place is newly divorced dads. All these kids at the pool kind of just confused - not a mom in sight.
I just picture all the kids getting sunburned because nobody remembers the sunscreen.
Oh man, I didn’t even think of sunscreen.
See you Friday?
Yep.
Okay! What do we want to do today? I missed you so much.
May we pet your dog?
We love dogs!
That one?
May we chase your dog?
It’s so cool right?
You know that I love being your mom, right?
It makes me so happy. You are a wonderful kid.
I want to go back and grab you by the shoulders...
...And scream at you ‘you’re amazing! You’re my mother!
Go to Europe. Insist on your joy! Time is short...
...Don’t just do it for you, do it for me too!’
I always thought motherhood was sort of a weak state of being - like very basic and passive. But motherhood is a far more primal active thing than that.
It is probably the most violent experience a human can have aside from death itself.

A child’s first act is violence against the woman who created it. Yet still the mother loves the child with the most powerful love known in this universe. Miriam is a wild boar, Liz is a moose. And Norma is there as a wise owl.
This thing comes from us. It rips its way out of us, literally tears us in two, in a wash of blood and shit and piss.

Or it is cut from us with a knife, our organs taken out only to be put back in and sewn up. So no - motherhood is not sunshine and baby powder, little pastel mints and lacy frocks. Motherhood is fucking brutal - and it turns us into something we weren’t before.
Not really. *
I didn’t get it.
What? Didn’t get what?
I just - didn’t see it. I didn’t * see all that you were giving up. *
Right. *
I mean, look at what you fucking * did! I feel like I’ve been let in * to a whole universe that I was * totally blind to. *
Oh. *
It’s just right in front of my eyes * now - it’s here, and it’s * beautiful. It’s undeniable. All the * things you weren’t able to say for * all those years. *
Honey - *
I am in fucking awe of you. You are * the giver of life. *
You are the giver of life to our * son, and I should have been so much * more ... I don’t know what. I * should have given that so much more * respect. *
I should have told you to not give * this up. I really fucked up. And I * am so sorry. *
Thank you. Thank you for being * willing to say that. *
And you were right about something. * I think I wanted you to stay home. *
Because that’s what my mom did, I * guess. I didn’t realize I was doing * it. I swear. It’s some idea that * just seeped into my consciousness * without me even realizing it. But * that was wrong. *
You can’t give this up - you have * too much to say. You’re so weird * and I love you. *
I love you. *
I’m gonna go relieve the sitter. *
I can go with you. *
No - go meet up with the book * babies moms. They’re at the bar * waiting for you. *
Really? You sure? *
Are you kidding me? This is your night. Please go enjoy it. I’m going to go hug our sleeping child, and think about what magic it is that brought him into the world. *
I’m proud of you. *
There are times when I look to my son and I cannot tell where he begins and I end. He is that much a part of me.
This must be what it is to be an animal. To look at another and say ‘I am so much that other thing that we are part of one another’.
I want blackberries.
I want salmon.
What? We’ve got Santa’s head here to eat?

This is how it’s always been and how it will continue to be. From outside their blanket cave, we see the warm light of their game, their shadows look like real bears in the cave - the sounds of bear roars fill the warm bedroom, which is now transformed into a forest with trees having sprouted up all around the tent.
Yes yes. You’re doing so well. You’re doing great. You’re amazing.
AHHHHH! I can’t. I can’t do it.
